channel.description: Recent content in life update on Miranda Zhang's Website

item.title: Bay Area Wishlist
item.description:
I have a GDoc with things-I-want-to-do in the Bay Area! I would be excited to do these with friends, so please see if you’d be interested in joining me to do any of these!

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CQwZ-XOcRDBXu1ZI6F_BwAj6q4ZjbLl8icndcpbMpwM/edit?usp=sharing

(context below)

~ request for collective hivemind thoughts ~

I’m worried about how best to address my burnout before my OPT unemployment ends in mid-August and I would appreciate suggestions for any of the below approaches

  1. In one month, make a really concerted effort to tackle my burn-out. This may include
  • going on a short nature retreat (is there some way I can do this for ~free?)
  • doing Focusing (who can teach me?)
  • cuddle sessions (I should probably schedule these)
  • going nuclear (i.e., withdraw from EA for the month)
  1. Leave the US until I’m ready to work

Really undesirable because I like the people and environment here! Possibly mitigated if I can actually come up with things I’d be excited to do. Less likely: staying with my parents. More likely: staying with my friends

Soooo is there anyone who’d be willing to let me stay at theirs for ~.5-1 month? I imagine the UK is going to be the likeliest candidate
